result.execSummary:
The defendant Drake Martin Michael Dykeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent jail time in lieu of $518 costs.
Concurrent with any other sentence now serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drake Martin Michael Dykeman

records.addlTxt: Defendant Drake Martin Michael Dykeman in court in custody with attorney Kelly James Mattingly.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Guilty plea; Court finds defendant guilty.  PSI WAIVED.  Court orders 1 year jail, concurrent with any sentence now serving; concurrent jail time in lieu of costs; 29 days sentence credit.  Felon warnings advised.

Defendant Drake Martin Michael Dykeman in court in custody with attorney Kelly James Mattingly.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
